019package org.jgrapes.http.events;
020
021import java.net.URI;
022import java.net.URISyntaxException;
023import java.net.URL;
024import java.util.Iterator;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Optional;
027import java.util.Stack;
028import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
029import java.util.stream.Collectors;
030import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpConstants.HttpProtocol;
031import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpRequest;
032import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
033import org.jgrapes.core.CompletionEvent;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
035import org.jgrapes.http.ResourcePattern;
036import org.jgrapes.http.ResourcePattern.PathSpliterator;
037import org.jgrapes.net.TcpChannel;
038
039/**
040 * The base class for all HTTP requests such as {@link Request.In.Get},
041 * {@link Request.In.Post} etc.
042 *
043 * @param <R> the generic type
044 */
045public class Request<R> extends MessageReceived<R> {
046
047    /**
048     * @param channels
049     */
050    protected Request(Channel... channels) {
051        super(channels);
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * The base class for all incoming HTTP requests. Incoming
056     * request flow downstream and are served by the framework. 
057     * 
058     * A result of `true` indicates that the request has been processed, 
059     * i.e. a response has been sent or will sent.
060     */
061    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortClassName")
062    public static class In extends Request<Boolean> {
063
064        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidFieldNameMatchingTypeName")
065        private final HttpRequest request;
066        private final int matchLevels;
067        private final MatchValue matchValue;
068        private final URI resourceUri;
069        private URI uri;
070
071        /**
072         * Creates a new request event with the associated {@link Completed}
073         * event.
074         * 
075         * @param protocol the protocol as reported by {@link #requestUri()}
076         * @param request the request data
077         * @param matchLevels the number of elements from the request path
078         * to use in the match value (see {@link #matchValue})
079         * @param channels the channels associated with this event
080         * @throws URISyntaxException 
081         */
082        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.UselessParentheses",
083            "PMD.ConstructorCallsOverridableMethod" })
084        public In(String protocol, HttpRequest request,
085                int matchLevels, Channel... channels)
086                throws URISyntaxException {
087            super(channels);
088            new Completed(this);
089            this.request = request;
090            this.matchLevels = matchLevels;
091
092            // Do any required processing of the original request URI
093            URI requestUri = effectiveRequestUri(protocol, request);
094            // Clean the request URI's path, keeping the segments for matchValue
095            List<String> segs = pathToSegs(requestUri);
096            requestUri = new URI(requestUri.getScheme(),
097                requestUri.getUserInfo(), requestUri.getHost(),
098                requestUri.getPort(),
099                "/" + segs.stream().collect(Collectors.joining("/")),
100                requestUri.getQuery(), null);
101            setRequestUri(requestUri);
102
103            // The URI for handler selection ignores user info and query
104            resourceUri = new URI(requestUri.getScheme(), null,
105                requestUri.getHost(), requestUri.getPort(),
106                requestUri.getPath(), null, null);
107            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.InefficientStringBuffering")
108            StringBuilder matchPath = new StringBuilder("/" + segs.stream()
109                .limit(matchLevels).collect(Collectors.joining("/")));
110            if (segs.size() > matchLevels) {
111                if (!matchPath.toString().endsWith("/")) {
112                    matchPath.append('/');
113                }
114                matchPath.append('â€¦');
115            }
116            matchValue = new MatchValue(getClass(),
117                (requestUri.getScheme() == null ? ""
118                    : (requestUri.getScheme() + "://"))
119                    + (requestUri.getHost() == null ? ""
120                        : (requestUri.getHost()
121                            + (requestUri.getPort() == -1 ? ""
122                                : (":" + requestUri.getPort()))))
123                    + matchPath);
124        }
125
126        private List<String> pathToSegs(URI requestUri)
127                throws URISyntaxException {
128            Iterator<String> origSegs = PathSpliterator.stream(
129                requestUri.getPath()).iterator();
130            // Path must be absolute
131            if (!origSegs.hasNext() || !origSegs.next().isEmpty()) {
132                throw new URISyntaxException(requestUri().getPath(),
133                    "Must be absolute");
134            }
135            // Remove dot segments
136            Stack<String> segs = new Stack<>();
137            while (origSegs.hasNext()) {
138                String seg = origSegs.next();
139                if (".".equals(seg)) {
140                    continue;
141                }
142                if ("..".equals(seg)) {
143                    if (!segs.isEmpty()) {
144                        segs.pop();
145                    }
146                    continue;
147                }
148                if (!segs.isEmpty() && segs.peek().isEmpty()) {
149                    segs.pop();
150                }
151                segs.push(seg);
152            }
153            return segs;
154        }
155
156        /**
157         * Builds the URI that represents this request. The default
158         * implementation checks that request URI in the HTTP request
159         * is directed at this server as specified in the "Host"-header
160         * and adds the protocol, host and port if not specified 
161         * in the request URI. 
162         *
163         * @param protocol the protocol
164         * @param request the request
165         * @return the URI
166         * @throws URISyntaxException if the request is not acceptable
167         */
168        protected URI effectiveRequestUri(String protocol, HttpRequest request)
169                throws URISyntaxException {
170            URI serverUri = new URI(protocol, null,
171                request.host(), request.port(), "/", null, null);
172            URI origRequest = request.requestUri();
173            URI result = serverUri.resolve(new URI(null, null, null, -1,
174                origRequest.getPath(), origRequest.getQuery(), null));
175            if (!result.getScheme().equals(protocol)
176                || !result.getHost().equals(request.host())
177                || result.getPort() != request.port()) {
178                throw new URISyntaxException(origRequest.toString(),
179                    "Scheme, host or port not allowed");
180            }
181            return result;
182        }
183
184        /**
185         * Creates the appropriate derived request event type from
186         * a given {@link HttpRequest}.
187         * 
188         * @param request the HTTP request
189         * @param secure whether the request was received over a secure channel
190         * @param matchLevels the match levels
191         * @return the request event
192         * @throws URISyntaxException 
193         */
194        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
195        public static In fromHttpRequest(
196                HttpRequest request, boolean secure, int matchLevels)
197                throws URISyntaxException {
198            switch (request.method()) {
199            case "OPTIONS":
200                return new Options(request, secure, matchLevels);
201            case "GET":
202                return new Get(request, secure, matchLevels);
203            case "HEAD":
204                return new Head(request, secure, matchLevels);
205            case "POST":
206                return new Post(request, secure, matchLevels);
207            case "PUT":
208                return new Put(request, secure, matchLevels);
209            case "DELETE":
210                return new Delete(request, secure, matchLevels);
211            case "TRACE":
212                return new Trace(request, secure, matchLevels);
213            case "CONNECT":
214                return new Connect(request, secure, matchLevels);
215            default:
216                return new In(secure ? "https" : "http", request, matchLevels);
217            }
218        }
219
220        /**
221         * Sets the request URI.
222         *
223         * @param uri the new request URI
224         */
225        protected final void setRequestUri(URI uri) {
226            this.uri = uri;
227        }
228
229        /**
230         * Returns an absolute URI of the request. For incoming requests, the 
231         * URI is built from the information provided by the decoder.
232         * 
233         * @return the URI
234         */
235        public final URI requestUri() {
236            return uri;
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Returns the "raw" request as provided by the HTTP decoder.
241         * 
242         * @return the request
243         */
244        public HttpRequest httpRequest() {
245            return request;
246        }
247
248        /**
249         * The match value consists of the event class and a URI.
250         * The URI is similar to the request URI but its path elements
251         * are shortened as specified in the constructor.
252         * 
253         * The match value is used as key in a map that speeds up
254         * the lookup of handlers. Having the complete URI in the match
255         * value would inflate this map.
256         *
257         * @return the object
258         * @see org.jgrapes.core.Event#defaultCriterion()
259         */
260        @Override
261        public Object defaultCriterion() {
262            return matchValue;
263        }
264
265        /*
266         * (non-Javadoc)
267         * 
268         * @see org.jgrapes.core.Event#isMatchedBy(java.lang.Object)
269         */
270        @Override
271        public boolean isEligibleFor(Object value) {
272            if (!(value instanceof MatchValue)) {
273                return super.isEligibleFor(value);
274            }
275            MatchValue mval = (MatchValue) value;
276            if (!mval.type.isAssignableFrom(matchValue.type)) {
277                return false;
278            }
279            if (mval.resource instanceof ResourcePattern) {
280                return ((ResourcePattern) mval.resource).matches(resourceUri,
281                    matchLevels) >= 0;
282            }
283            return mval.resource.equals(matchValue.resource);
284        }
285
286        /*
287         * (non-Javadoc)
288         * 
289         * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
290         */
291        @Override
292        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidLiteralsInIfCondition")
293        public String toString() {
294            StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
295            builder.append(Components.objectName(this))
296                .append(" [\"");
297            String path = Optional.ofNullable(request.requestUri().getPath())
298                .orElse("");
299            if (path.length() > 15) {
300                builder.append("...")
301                    .append(path.substring(path.length() - 12));
302            } else {
303                builder.append(path);
304            }
305            builder.append('\"');
306            if (channels().length > 0) {
307                builder.append(", channels=");
308                builder.append(Channel.toString(channels()));
309            }
310            builder.append(']');
311            return builder.toString();
312        }
313
314        /**
315         * Creates the match value.
316         *
317         * @param type the type
318         * @param resource the resource
319         * @return the object
320         */
321        public static Object createMatchValue(
322                Class<?> type, ResourcePattern resource) {
323            return new MatchValue(type, resource);
324        }
325
326        /**
327         * Represents a match value.
328         */
329        private static class MatchValue {
330            private final Class<?> type;
331            private final Object resource;
332
333            /**
334             * @param type
335             * @param resource
336             */
337            public MatchValue(Class<?> type, Object resource) {
338                super();
339                this.type = type;
340                this.resource = resource;
341            }
342
343            /*
344             * (non-Javadoc)
345             * 
346             * @see java.lang.Object#hashCode()
347             */
348            @Override
349            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
350            public int hashCode() {
351                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidFinalLocalVariable")
352                final int prime = 31;
353                int result = 1;
354                result = prime * result
355                    + ((resource == null) ? 0 : resource.hashCode());
356                result
357                    = prime * result + ((type == null) ? 0 : type.hashCode());
358                return result;
359            }
360
361            /*
362             * (non-Javadoc)
363             * 
364             * @see java.lang.Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
365             */
366            @Override
367            public boolean equals(Object obj) {
368                if (this == obj) {
369                    return true;
370                }
371                if (obj == null) {
372                    return false;
373                }
374                if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
375                    return false;
376                }
377                MatchValue other = (MatchValue) obj;
378                if (resource == null) {
379                    if (other.resource != null) {
380                        return false;
381                    }
382                } else if (!resource.equals(other.resource)) {
383                    return false;
384                }
385                if (type == null) {
386                    if (other.type != null) {
387                        return false;
388                    }
389                } else if (!type.equals(other.type)) {
390                    return false;
391                }
392                return true;
393            }
394
395        }
396
397        /**
398         * The associated completion event.
399         */
400        public static class Completed extends CompletionEvent<In> {
401
402            /**
403             * Instantiates a new event.
404             *
405             * @param monitoredEvent the monitored event
406             * @param channels the channels
407             */
408            public Completed(In monitoredEvent, Channel... channels) {
409                super(monitoredEvent, channels);
410            }
411        }
412
413        /**
414         * Represents a HTTP CONNECT request.
415         */
416        public static class Connect extends In {
417
418            /**
419             * Create a new event.
420             * 
421             * @param request the request data
422             * @param secure indicates whether the request was received on a
423             * secure channel
424             * @param matchLevels the number of elements from the request path
425             * to use in the match value
426             * @param channels the channels on which the event is to be 
427             * fired (optional)
428             * @throws URISyntaxException 
429             */
430            public Connect(HttpRequest request, boolean secure, int matchLevels,
431                    Channel... channels) throws URISyntaxException {
432                super(secure ? "https" : "http", request, matchLevels,
433                    channels);
434            }
435
436            /**
437             * Builds the URI that represents this request. This
438             * implementation returns the request URI without
439             * path and query component. 
440             *
441             * @param protocol the protocol
442             * @param request the request
443             * @return the uri
444             * @throws URISyntaxException the URI syntax exception
445             * @see "[RFC 7230, Section 5.5](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7230#section-5.5)"
446             */
447            protected URI effectiveRequestUri(String protocol,
448                    HttpRequest request) throws URISyntaxException {
449                URI req = request.requestUri();
450                return new URI(req.getScheme(), req.getUserInfo(),
451                    req.getHost(), req.getPort(), null, null, null);
452            }
453        }
454
455        /**
456         * The Class Delete.
457         */
458        public static class Delete extends In {
459
460            /**
461            * Create a new event.
462            * 
463            * @param request the request data
464            * @param secure indicates whether the request was received on a
465            * secure channel
466            * @param matchLevels the number of elements from the request path
467            * to use in the match value
468            * @param channels the channels on which the event is to be 
469            * fired (optional)
470             * @throws URISyntaxException 
471            */
472            public Delete(HttpRequest request, boolean secure, int matchLevels,
473                    Channel... channels) throws URISyntaxException {
474                super(secure ? "https" : "http", request, matchLevels,
475                    channels);
476            }
477
478        }
479

625
626    /**
627     * The base class for all outgoing HTTP requests. Outgoing
628     * request flow upstream and are served externally. 
629     * 
630     * A result of `true` indicates that the request has been processed, 
631     * i.e. a response has been sent or will sent.
632     */
633    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortClassName")
634    public static class Out extends Request<Void> {
635
636        private HttpRequest request;
637        private BiConsumer<Request.Out, TcpChannel> connectedCallback;
638
639        /**
640         * Instantiates a new request.
641         *
642         * @param method the method
643         * @param url the url
644         */
645        public Out(String method, URL url) {
646            try {
647                request = new HttpRequest(method, url.toURI(),
648                    HttpProtocol.HTTP_1_1, false);
649            } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
650                // This should not happen because every valid URL can be
651                // converted to a URI.
652                throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
653            }
654        }
655
656        /**
657         * Sets a "connected callback". When the {@link Out} event is
658         * created, the network connection is not yet known. Some
659         * header fields' values, however, need e.g. the port information
660         * from the connection. Therefore a callback may be set which is
661         * invoked when the connection has been obtained that will be used
662         * to send the request.
663         *
664         * @param connectedCallback the connected callback
665         * @return the out
666         */
667        public Out setConnectedCallback(
668                BiConsumer<Request.Out, TcpChannel> connectedCallback) {
669            this.connectedCallback = connectedCallback;
670            return this;
671        }
672
673        /**
674         * Returns the connected callback.
675         *
676         * @return the connected callback, if set
677         */
678        public Optional<BiConsumer<Request.Out, TcpChannel>>
679                connectedCallback() {
680            return Optional.ofNullable(connectedCallback);
681        }
682
683        /**
684         * The HTTP request that will be sent by the event.
685         *
686         * @return the http request
687         */
688        public HttpRequest httpRequest() {
689            return request;
690        }
691
692        /**
693         * Returns an absolute URI of the request.
694         * 
695         * @return the URI
696         */
697        public URI requestUri() {
698            return request.requestUri();
699        }
700
701        /*
702         * (non-Javadoc)
703         * 
704         * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
705         */
706        @Override
707        public String toString() {
708            StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
709            builder.append(Components.objectName(this))
710                .append(" [").append(request.toString());
711            if (channels().length > 0) {
712                builder.append(", channels=");
713                builder.append(Channel.toString(channels()));
714            }
715            builder.append(']');
716            return builder.toString();
717        }
718
719        /**
720         * Represents a HTTP CONNECT request.
721         */
722        public static class Connect extends Out {
723
724            /**
725             * Instantiates a new request.
726             *
727             * @param uri the uri
728             */
729            public Connect(URL uri) {
730                super("CONNECT", uri);
731            }
732        }
733
734        /**
735         * Represents a HTTP DELETE request.
736         */
737        public static class Delete extends Out {

739            /**

741             *
742             * @param uri the uri
743             */
744            public Delete(URL uri) {
745                super("DELETE", uri);
746            }
747        }

822        }
823
824        /**
825         * Represents a HTTP TRACE request.
826         */
827        public static class Trace extends Out {
828
829            /**
830             * Instantiates a new request.
831             *
832             * @param uri the uri
833             */
834            public Trace(URL uri) {
835                super("TRACE", uri);
836            }
837        }
838    }
839}
